definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.chinese: 当然，机器人不能唠闲嗑儿。

sentences.english: Some of the furniture in this old house has been gnawed away by rats.
sentences.chinese: 这所老房子里的一些家具已经被老鼠嗑坏了。

sentences.english: This is very likley a case of doping.
sentences.chinese: 这非常像是一个嗑药的案例。

sentences.english: And the neighbors were dancing outside coked out and naked.
sentences.chinese: 邻居在光天化日之下裸体跳舞和嗑药。

sentences.english: My supine slowly-rotating Lao hi teeth, all say oneself is the big brother.
sentences.chinese: 仰脖朝天唠嗨嗑，都说自己是大哥。

sentences.english: Or, in the case of addiction, a drug that weakens the associations that stir craving.
sentences.chinese: 或者，在成瘾性方面，药物减弱了嗑药的联系。

sentences.english: The funny thing is, Blair never used drugs.
sentences.chinese: 有趣的是，布莱尔从未嗑药。

sentences.english: The kids thought it was cool to go to class juiced.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们误以为在学校嗑药是件酷的事情。

sentences.english: Were you sleeping with me because of the drugs?
sentences.chinese: 你是因为嗑药才和我上床吗？

sentences.english: If a man had earrings it was a sign that he was on drugs.
sentences.chinese: 如果一个男人戴耳环说明这个人在嗑药。

sentences.english: The rats have eaten holes in those bags of flour.
sentences.chinese: 大老鼠把那些面粉袋嗑出了窟窿。

sentences.english: The spurs of the cavalry officer clanged as he walked across the porch.
sentences.chinese: 骑兵军官从廊上走过，马刺嗑啷嗑啷地响。

sentences.english: The spurs of the cavalry officer clanged as he walked across the porch.
sentences.chinese: 骑兵军官从廊上走过，马刺嗑啷嗑啷地响。

sentences.english: The girls were eating away at the melon seeds, chatting.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘们一边聊天，一边在津津有问地嗑着瓜子。

sentences.english: I'll be 75 and hanging around bars yacking it up.
sentences.chinese: 我快75岁了，就只剩蹲酒吧嗑闲的份儿了。

sentences.english: Your daughter is using cocaine. Put her in a rehabilitation clinic.
sentences.chinese: 你的女儿在嗑药，请带她到康复治疗诊所。

definition: melon seed/seeds of pumpkin, watermelon or sunflower etc, roasted and flavored, consumed as a snack
to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)
to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
erhua variant of 聊天[liao2 tian1]
